main event: An observer spotted a round white object the size of a 12" dinner plate near Erie, Pennsylvania on August 12, 1958.
interesting points: The observation lasted for about 15 minutes,The object faded to the east while appearing to be stationary but changing position,Weather conditions were calm with unlimited visibility,The observer used binoculars to view the object in daylight/night,Unusual activity from SAC aircraft was noted in the area.
witness description: Observer was from U.S. Coast Guard, unknown identity.
